column2: 2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/19/2019 7:25:12 PM$Reviewer: Hurt, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $1$1$1$I was diagnosed as ADHD in 4th grade and prescribed Ritalin
column3: 6th grade they saw it wasn't working and they prescribed me Adderall 2 pills in the morning 2 pills by lunch I went from to energetic to sleep in every class... But because i had to urinate all the time after i started the medicine some time I'd be so sleep I'd dream i was in a restroom urinating and the warm sensation of peeing on myself would wake me up to a class room of embarrassment. My throat muscles stopped working so i couldn't eat breakfast lunch or after school only intake liquid (parents cook and don't understand that i literally couldn't swallow my food
column4: whooped or screamed wasting food {but i would be hungry}). From time to time i would  stand up and everything would look like a frying TV channel (Black white and gray dots is all i would see scared i was going blind
column5: still happens now). I would get random rashes that would start looking like a ant bite and spread till it vanised i thought it was something wrong with me so i separated my self fell deep into depression until i dropped out of school 2007 and stopped taking the medicine. After about 6 years those rashes slowed down still stuggle eating socially awkward (don't know how to handle socializing at work) still have to urinate every 20-30 min (interferes with my jobs to many breaks) i was a kid whos school had my mom put me on the medicine i didn't pay for it but i was a kid effected by the medicine and the #LABEL of ADHD and the #Process of #ADHD

column1: 6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/6/2018 2:09:38 AM$Reviewer: MrCook
column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I struggled to concentrate my whole life. I was called a ""high aptitude/low achiever"". ""If he would just buckle down and do the work...his mind wanders...he refuses to get his work done. He's unprepared...he always has an excuse... He's disorganized."" I heard these comments from everyone. I frustrated my teachers
column3: my parents and myself. I couldn't pay attention. School was a nightmare that seemed to last forever. I couldn't wait for each class to end. Yet I would do well on tests. I'd get terrible grades for class participation and homework assignments
column4: but then I would get an A or a B on midterms and finals and end up with a B or a C in the course. In college I discovered amphetamines
column5: which are much stronger than Adderall but had the same effect on my ability to concentrate. I'd be failing a course all semester
column6: skipping classes
column7: losing my homework
column8: etc.
column9: but then I'd get some ""speed"" and learn the entire course from the book in a couple of days and ace the final. I was accused of cheating once because professor didn't believe I could have learned so much in such a short period. I was self-medicating
column10: but I didn't know it. There was no such thing as ADD or ADHD in the 60's and 70'. I thought there was something wrong with me and I was wrong to take amphetamines. I couldn't take them all the time; the side effects were extreme. After college
column11: I had to accept mediocrity in almost everything
column12: but I got by. At 50
column13: a shrink finally recognized my ADHD and prescribed Adderall. One of the best days of my life. No more antidepressants
column14: no more confusion and no more procrastination and mediocre achievement. The fog had lifted. My life is so much better in every way. I've learned to accept that where I am today is the culmination of everything I've ever done. I can't regret that because I am happier now than I've ever been. Medical science has saved me. My newfound ability to think and act rationally has made it so I can help others through this sometimes confusing life.

8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/13/2018 7:49:21 PM$Reviewer: Darby1, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was misdiagnosed for the first 17 years of my life
column2: I was forced to take antidepressants that scared me and didn't work. I failed at everything. I would have emotional outbursts from being so overwhelmed. I saw so many doctors and counselors I felt like I was broken and no one was able to ""fix"" me. As I grew up I learned ways to manage my symptoms but it was exhausting. If i was succeeding at any point it always ended with failure or side tracked resulting in countless unfinished things that made me feel incompetent. ""Jack of all trades; master at none"". I knew I was capable of so much more but the distractions of hearing
column3: seeing
column4: feeling
column5: smelling everything in my environment all at the same time made me dizzy and I couldn't sort it all out. It wasnt until a little over a year ago I began therapy
column6: seeing a wonderful Psychiatrist who UNDERSTOOD ME! For the first time in my life i was reassured i wasnt alone. Apprehensively I began taking this medicine
column7: it took over 6 months to start feeling in control of my mind
column8: but now I have it figured out. Instead of hearing music
column9: I am listening to the instruments. I can single out the drummer and follow his beats to the end. I am maintaining a high GPA in college
column10: I am organized
column11: efficient and I no longer feel like a crack in the sidewalk of life. I hate that people without a diagnosis
column12: who aren't struggling are abusing this medicine that helps so many people function at high capacity who truly need it! The biggest draw back for me is seeing what I could've done years ago but didn't. I have noticed my heart rate goes up spontaneously which can be scary
column13: but it does pass. I have to learn to give myself credit for my successes
column14: I am not my medication or ADHD but they have both added to the positives of who I am. If you have been struggling
column15: reach out!"

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/24/2018 6:22:44 AM$Reviewer: CLBK
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I was fortunate to have a Doctor that asked questions and diagnosed me in my 40's. If I had been diagnosed earlier my life would have been better. I take Adderall 30 mg XL capsules and it changed my life. I feel normal! For my treatment this form and dosage works great. I take it about an hour before I'll be getting up and I'm able to function and stay focused at my job and at home. It doesn't make me jittery or hyper
column3: doesn't take my appetite away ( I often wish it would!) I still occasionally need a nap during the day and have no problem falling asleep at night. I've always had low blood pressure
column4: low body temperature
column5: and low blood sugar but they tell me my thyroid levels are fine. I used to get a lot of migraines and had to have Imitrex Nasal with me all the time. Now I very seldom need it. For me personally Adderall has been a life saver! I take it as directed
column6: don't abuse it
column7: see my doctor regularly and can live a productive life. I've been on it for about ten years now
column8: I'm female and 60 years old.

column1: 11$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/4/2018 9:30:37 PM$Reviewer: Ize
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Made college a possibility for me. I was able to focus and perform well in my classes. Before that I had been failing but knew I could do more than my grades were showing. Over the years (17 or so I believe) I have remained on the same dose with no side effects. I have since been promoted at work and although I am struggling to learn time management on a whole new level I suspect that is normal and not due to ADHD. I continue to take my medication to maintain a level of ""normal"" cognative function like everyone else. Otherwise everything that crossed my mind would cross my lips and I couldn't keep my emotions in check. I would easily be overwhelmed by projects or anything that involved multiple steps and people depending on me. I would wilt under the pressure. Adderall allows me the ability to focus my thoughts and slow my mental process down. Filter the thousand bits of input I'm bombardrd with every moment. I can see the forrest through the leaves... This medication has been pivotal to my success and I was able to stop taking antidepressants after being on Adderall. I finally felt normal. Hopefully my review helps put a parent at ease when considering if they should put their child on Adderall or not. "

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Adderall makes me feel normal.

column1: Without it I space out
column2: have trouble prioritizing and getting around to doing what I need to do
column3: and can't function as an adult. Before I started taking it I would pick fights (arguments) in order to get my adrenalin to go up so I could do things. Now I'm even-keeled all day long (and have learnt to space out dosage through the day in order to be even-keeled).

column1: I never take more than what I've been prescribed (60mg) and depending on the day I can function well on as little as 40mg.  This blue pill has changed my life. I've been on the same prescription for almost 20 years now.
I once took too much and felt bad but it didn't feel like a ""high"".  If I wanted to get high Aderall would be the last thing I would take
column2: because all it does is to make me normal.

column1: Note I have the Inactive diagnosis of ADHD meaning I was never hyperactive. I retreated into my inner world and spaced out instead.
Hope this helps others like me.

column1: 34$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/1/2016 12:33:18 PM$Reviewer: Smalloni
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $3$1$1$My son was changed from Ritalin to Adderall at age 13. After a short while of being on Adderall he became very angry and defiant. We thought that since he was going through puberty & dealing with ADHD that he was just having a rough time dealing with the chemistry changing in his body. As time went on he became more aggressive threatening to stab his father with a butcher knife & constantly going up against his dad & peers at school. He distroyed things in his path & punched holes in the walls of our home
column3: yelling & cursing when anyone rubbed him the wrong way. The slightest things would set him off into fits of rage. He took on multiple personalities one being very evil as if Satan's son. He was a Jeckyll & Hyde.  This went on for 4 years as the dosage was increased because of his high tolerance to Adderall. After being in support groups & reading up I discovered other we're experiencing these very same side affects. I demanded the doctor to take him off of it and since he's been off of it for 6 months now & almost instantly I got my sweet boy back. I read that Adderall was like taking crystal meth. This medicine needs to be removed from the market permanently in my opinion. He was in & out of the hospital 4 times in a 3 months time frame. Not once had the doctors ever try taking him off the Adderall. All they did was ginnea pig him pumping him full of antipsychotic meds. He ended up for the first time in his life getting in trouble with the police for assault on an officer
column4: resisting arrest & interfering with police business. Adderall is a very dangerous medication. If you benefit from it without the bad side affects
column5: then that is good. If not
column6: I would not take this medication.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$3$I started adderall in mid-2013. I felt I couldn't function w/out it even though my jaws were clenched more often than not. I believe she is a source of adderall for students who attend university about a half-mile from her practice. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $3$1$5$"My story is a tad different. I work online with addicts
column3: so have a warning for parents.

column2: and also tell them what to add to improve the 'rush'.

column1: Please - don't let your children use this unless it is vital and justified
column2: such as for narcolepsy or ADHD. And
column3: if your child is addicted
column4: defiant and refusing rehab
column5: please learn to help him or her via e.g. an online course for parents with addict children such as Parent CRAFT (cadenceonline.com). I know I might sound like a crazy lady
column6: but this drug is being widely abused by students and too many health care professionals prescribe it without caring about consequences. "

column1: 39$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/6/2016 11:21:36 PM$Reviewer: brooke26
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking Adderall for over about 17 years. Without this medication I would never have graduated high school
column3: college
column4: and be working on my second degree. Sometimes medication is the only option for those who try everything possible first. This drug is nothing to play with
column5: it takes precise clock work
column6: discipline and knowledge. You have to ensure you are keeping your body healthy when taking it. Yes
column7: it does have side effects but yes it does work great for those who need this type of chemical balance. If you want to prevent the ""rush"" as some report
column8: EAT first. Then
column9: make sure you drink more than the minimum amount of water a day. I literally drink about 10 waters a day. Stay away from caffeine and make sure to NEVER take this med. at night unless you don't plan on sleeping
column10: which is another thing to make sure you are getting enough of. A balanced diet
column11: sleep
column12: and overall life routine is important. I also wouldn't recommend you take it if you are going to a social event
column13: because like me I'm not the socialist butterfly on it when I would normally talk an ear off. With proper care and balance this is the answer for most. It is my answer and I'm more than thankful I have gotten as far as I have and I am thankful for its creation. I hope this helps some and also to the mothers
column14: when your child is on this med. it's best to leave them alone. They just want to focus and most likely won't want to eat. Sometimes I will even take a 1/2 of my instant release(4 hr tabs) if I have school work still to help ease the crashing. Lots of water to prevent headaches and time the pills. I don't get the full 8 hours that some would
column15: I'm about 4 hours and I begin to fade. My doctor has me prescribed 1 8hr cap in am(7am) and then by 12pm one 4hrtab
column16: 4pm one 4hrtab. single mom so long day"

134$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/20/2014 10:00:56 PM$Reviewer: Alex, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on Strattera for about 5 years and switching to adderall has been one of the best decisions i've made. Adderall is essentially like taking 10 red bulls. It can work for longer periods, but the biggest bonus is the quality of work that I can produce. The reason being, adderall gives me the ability to be able to be much more focused on the material and as a result, I retain it better. There is a downside however. If taken too late in the day, it can keep you awake and sometimes you can feel a bit overstimulated. Another thing to watch for may be a slight change in behaviour. I had family members that hadn't seen me in several months tell me that I seemed too stimulated during regular conversation. In terms of dosage, I personally found 20mg to be more than enough but this varies from person to person. Overall my experience has been great, it has helped me bridge that gap that has kept me from performing like the rest of the students in my classes.
135$Condition: Other$6/17/2014 6:43:28 PM$Reviewer: Me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I was only using 10 mg for about 3 yrs. it was just enough to help me be more focused, even out my emotions and have more sustainable energy. As long as I was excersizing regularly, eating healthy and getting the sleep my body needed, I never felt I needed more than 10 mg. Once I started to slack in my healthy eating and regular excersize, I started to become more sluggish and unfocused and eventually jumped up to 15mg. I don't love how it makes me feel. After 6 months of the 15mg I felt I could use more but decided that I was not going to fall victim so once again, I have been getting back on track with my eating and excersize and have lost 5 pds  and already feel so much better. I do not crave more Adderall so by continuing good healthy habits, i'll see if I need to adjust back to 10 mg or stay on the 15 mg. I've learned that Adderall is not a substitute for unhealthy habits.

139$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/4/2014 10:21:56 AM$Reviewer: mandyslayton, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking adderall xr for almost 3 years now.
It has changed my life for the better.
I am a 35 year old female who my parents didn't believe in me taking drugs like this as a child.I knew I had issues in high school
and I know for a fact had I been on this medication I would have done better in school
and would have cared about going to college.

I finally did something for myself when I turned 30 and went to a psychiatrist. It took a few different medications(concerta/vyvanse) before my Dr put me on Adderall. One made me so dizzy and one made my heart race.
I can see getting addicted
column2: but I knew with the way I live my life
column3: I wouldn't have to worry.

column1: I had major issues staying focused and awake no matter how much sleep I would get. I would get bored easily or start a dozen different tasks and not get one completed. I had no time management.
I started with 20mg and I take it in the am when I wake up at 6 am. It makes me want to do my job and not get stressed. I am much more
organized. It keeps my life on track.
I started getting headaches about 3 months in and just really tired again by 3 pm. When I went to my dr for a check up she decided to
try a half of a 20mg of plain adderall at 2pm.
It did the trick and I've been on this combination ever since and haven't had to change anything.
I go to bed by 10:30 or 11 pm. I hardly ever have trouble sleeping.  My heart doesn't race either.
A plus for me was it helped lose the weight from having my daughter a few years prior. I gained 70lbs and wasn't worried about losing
the last 30lbs but it was an added plus.
I don't have such an appetite loss like I did when I first started.
It helps me with portion control and I don't stuff my face like I used to before I started the medication.
It also helps me have normal bowel movements and regular.
I will tell you if I have to stay up later I do end up irritable and get quiet and just want to crash. That's about the only side effect I've experienced.

156$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/22/2014 10:17:58 AM$Reviewer: AdderallForADHD, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$2$I gave this medication a 2 out of 5 for Ease of Use because I have had a few issues with dosage size and perscription. When I lost a significant amount of weight (due to health changes - NOT the medication), my Dr. thought it might be best to alter my medication system, and for the next year my dose and brand was shuffled around, as a result every pharmacist in town thinks I am some cartel drug dealer. But once on the right dose for your body, Adderall is incredible for those with Attention Deficit. It will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. I can generally think much more clearly and am able to multi-task. If you need Adderall, it will work for you and you will NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. The medication for someone with ADHD will slow you, in a sense: making it clear and possible to make simple, rational decisions without struggle and giving you the ability to channel your energy and focus on what you need. I take 2 25mg XRs throughout the day, and have an optional add on of 10mg instant release for if I have a lot of homework or my XR wears off (I am a student, and mostly use the extra during exams or if I am writing a last minute essay the night before). I am an 18y/o 115 lb girl and pretty skinny, and this is the dose that works well for me (it deffinately isn't the same for everyone). The only problem I have found with Adderall is that on nights I take the optional 10mg, I have some trouble sleeping. But it's alright, because I don't take it often and usually if I do I need to stay awake that night anyways. However, if you do not have to pull frequent all-nighters, I would recommend never taking Adderall within  4 hours of your bedtime. Other than that, Adderall has provided me with the ability to focus in class, on my friends, after school, and accomplish the things I need to do, without ever getting too distracted or forgetting what I had to do.

166$Condition: Other$4/5/2014 11:37:27 PM$Reviewer: gratefullyfocused, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 54 year old male. I did not put two and two together when ADHD first came to light. It did not take long to realize the connection between ADHD and my younger days. I new years ago when ADHD was medically proven and legitimized (for lack of a better description) that it was my problem. I had learned to deal with it by working harder and longer than others would have to for the same results. I would accomplish what I needed to but where others would do it in an 8 hour work day, I would take it home and spend another 2 to 3 hours to accomplish the same amount of work to have it available at the same time as everyone else. A typical 8 hour day for anyone else was a 10 to 12 hour day for me. (this also helped me understand as an intelligent person the struggles in high school). This system worked for me as I progressed in my career until my latest and highest level management position. It didn't take long for me to realize I had progressed professionally beyond my ability to overcome my focus problems using the system that had gotten me by to this point to overcome the issue. The difference after Adderall has been profound, I have no doubt that had I not discussed the problem with my doctor and began taking Adderall I would have lost the position I now hold. This is coming from someone who at 54 years old was on no prescription medication for anything and proud of that accomplishment.

column1: 223$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/10/2013 1:44:49 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver) $5$5$5$If you truly need this medication and are on the correct dosage
column2: it will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. You will think more clearly and be able to multi-task. I've seen comments saying this is no different than meth or crack. That is inaccurate. If you need Adderall
column3: it will work for you and you DO NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. If you feel this way and have been diagnosed with ADHD your dose maybe too high or you might be a good candidate for the XR version. My husband's metabolism is too fast for extended release. He takes two doses a day to keep his level stable. This medication actually slows him in a sense. He is still very active but can focus and accomplish tasks effectively.

225$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/4/2013 2:16:09 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$My doctor treated me with the usual anti-depressants - Prozac
column2: Paxil
column3: Lexapro
column4: Klonopin
column5: etc for depression
column6: confusion
column7: lack of self worth
column8: crying.  Finally
column9: my Pain Management doctor
column10: who maintains my drug infusion pump gave me a prescription for Adderall XR.  I immediately noticed an improvement in my mental state.  I had more energy
column11: felt more stable
column12: better concentration
column13: even more able to deal with my chronic pain.  I started on 10 Mg daily and increased over time.  I am now on 40 mg XR daily.  I am certain that I could use another increase
column14: but I prefer stay as low as possible for as long as possible.  I will say that this has been the absolute best medication I have ever been on and the only one that dealt effectively with my depression.  I have never been able to deal with life in such a positive
column15: focused  and calm manner.  I hope I never have to stop taking this medication.  Even my Psychiatrist has noticed the difference in me and he recommends that I continue on this medication.  He said he is willing to prescribe it for me if there should ever be a reason I stop requiring the services of the doctor who prescribes it for me now.  I have been under treatment with the same psychiatrist for 12 years and he agrees that this medicine has been the best prescription for improving my depression and dealing with other very complicated issues in my life.  So
column16: for right now
column17: he says continue the good work and he is very pleased that I have found the correct medication. Over the course of therapy
column18: I have gone from 6 different medications a day down to 2.  I also still take .05 Klonopin at night
column19: if necessary
column20: for anxiety.  I am happy to say that I have never felt better.  I do realize this is an addictive drug
column22: it is also a necessary drug for some people and I am one of them.

column4: ""No

column1: 238$Condition: Other$11/8/2013 1:01:24 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$1$4$"Adderall worked great for the first year I was on it
column2: then it turned on me.  This is a serious medication with serious side effects
column3: I am shocked and disgusted that any parent would put a young child on such a strong drug for their ""ADD.""  I began with 20mg a day and had amazing grades while working full time as a bartender
column4: I honestly felt like every time I popped one of these I got a little ""high"" from it and euphoric.  It made me impulsive
column5: impatient
column6: obsessive compulsive
column7: and sometimes anti-social.  I wasn't aware how much this drug changed my personality until the third year I was on it.  I was fully addicted taking only 30 mg at the most in a day
column8: but when the pills went on back order I realized how bad withdrawal sucked from it.  I couldn't leave my bed or do the simplest tasks without popping an adderall for the day.  I also became paranoid
column9: and sometimes would hear things that weren't there
column10: that's when I knew this drug was messing my head up.  I quit taking adderall and it took a good 6 months for me to regain my natural energy. I'm back to my normal
column11: social
column12: happy self.  I think adderall causes serious problems with your body
column13: as I had heart palpitations
column14: poor circulation
column15: weight loss
column16: chest pains
column17: extreme insomnia
column18: and mental instability while on this drug.  PARENTS PLEASE DO NOT PUT YOUR CHILDREN ON THIS DRUG unless you want them to grow up to be full blown drug addicts who resent you for introducing them to what seems to be legal coke or speed."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$3$I have taken both adderallxr and Adderall ir. I like the long lasting version better. There are good and bad effects from the medicine. The good is that you get things done

column5: but I do use e cigs sometimes. Also

column7: because I never get thirsty while on Adderall which is odd. But if I don't hydrate myself
column8: I end up getting a headache .

column1: 287$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/11/2013 10:25:56 AM$Reviewer: Thankful
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I came to this site today to review opinions between ""Brand"" and generic Adderrall and thought I should add my personal experience with this medication.

column1: I was diagnosed with depression 14 years ago and was prescribed Paxil. After six months of little change in my condition
column2: I was prescribed Prozac and Xanax. Over the next few years
column3: my conditioned worsened. I was eventually prescribed Ambien for insomnia
column4: which was a huge mistake.

column1: I became addicted to Ambien
column2: not for the sleep benefits but for the Utopian feeling it provided me. I would take it several times during the day
column3: and quickly began running out of my prescriptions. This led to ""Doc Shopping
column4: and eventually I had three doctors writing me scripts every month.

column1: Long story short: my marriage fell apart
column2: I couldn't hold a job and I reached a point where I didn't care whether I lived or died.

column1: Three years ago
column2: I made an appt. with a young doctor at a university research facility. After describing my medical history and my current condition
column3: he said he believed I suffered from adult ADD. He started me on 10 mg of Adderall daily.

column1: Within two months
column2: I was completely off my depression meds (Cymbalta and Tofrenil) and had no desire whatsoever for the Ambien.

column1: I have now been taking 30 mg daily for the past year
column2: and am experiencing no addictive drug behavior whatsoever. I was also a daily drinker
column3: and now only drink 1-2 glasses of wine on the weekends. I have held a steady
column4: professional-level job for over three years now
column5: and my marriage has been restored.

column1: Through the grace of God
column2: I was led to a doctor who literally saved my life. This amazing drug has helped make all the difference. If you have been diagnosed with depression and nothing seems to help
column3: you may want to discuss this with your doctor."

333$Condition: Other$5/5/2013 10:16:35 PM$Reviewer: MollyGordy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was having trouble organizing my thoughts and tasks. I would start one thing then stop that and start something else....finishing neither task. I became very fidgety and also lethargic as well. My thought process was chaotic. My husband had passed away in January of 2013 and along with the grief from my loss, I also experienced deeper depression. There were things I wanted to do and things I NEEDED to do and just couldn't muster up the energy to do anything. There were many days that I didn't feel like getting dressed, washing up, brushing my teeth or even leaving the house. I also had the added task of finding a job. I remained unemployed during the time of my husband's sickness until his death-about 10 months. I couldn't even MAKE myself do anything! And that was depressing in itself. My doctor tried me on Adderall and it was a godsend! I was up and showered and dressed every morning, got caught up on housework, began the job hunt and became more social. I hope she never takes me off of it!

343$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/13/2013 9:08:03 AM$Reviewer: Horrible for Family,Awesome for Business, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$I worked my way up to 60-80mg daily for the year I took adderall. It was alot like making a deal with the devil.  YOU WILL BE SUCCESSFUL AT WHAT YOU DO.  YOU WILL GET ADDICTED.  It will stop working the same and u will not get the benifits u once received.  Coming down is not fun.  I started drinking everynight to even out my moods at night.  If not I would get very aggitated and angry.  I made well over a million dollars in the last year, but every emotional/personal issue took a back seat.  Do not take Adderall if you have a family.  You will regret it.

345$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 8:24:04 AM$Reviewer: Onslo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$Wonder drug ! I wish I had it when I was in school. I was labeled as a problem kid. Lazy,  always  in trouble. In the remedial classes in most subjects. Could not pay attention to things that were not interesting to me. Age 44 is when I was given my first dose of adderall. My kids were taking it for ADD. My doctor was treating me with anti depressants with no real results. He gave me a simple test to take in his office. Switched me to adderall to see if things in my life improved. With in just a few days I noticed Hugh improvements in my life. I was able to do things that I could never do before. Like understanding what I had just read, being able to focus on things that were always a challenge to me,so I avoided them. I could understand new concepts and enjoyed learning for the first time in my life. Before I struggled with following basic instructions and would get frustrated and just give up.  For me it was a new life that I could enjoy and be present and be part of things I was scared to get involved in. For fear that others would think I was slow or challenged. Adderall change my whole life for the better. I wonder where I would be today if I had been given this drug in my early school years. I own a very successfully catering business and I'm happy with my life. I will always wonder what I could have accomplished if I was given the right treatment when I was in school.

347$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/26/2013 2:58:08 PM$Reviewer: Christine Tobey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Adderall for about 2 years nows due to a decrease in mental ability to what I call""  Mentally Keep Up"".  As a nurse working nights on a very busy floor that I truly Love & Self Employed Auto Dealership
column2: I became more & more scatter brained & stressed due to the inability to stay focused.  Adderall has made life so much better
column3: in that I can focus & get things done as I once did with out all the stress & un organized state of mind.  It has not caused me to have weight loss
column4: infact I have gained & maintain with difficulty to loose weight.  I sleep well when I do sleep & it is just such a miracle drug for me.  I notice when I have taken vacations from it
column5: I can not think for myself & I can NOT stay still long enough  when trying to sit at my desk to get work done.   I am very concerned about the ability to get COMPLETELY off this drug & function as I should.  Haven't got that far yet but will surely let you know when or if I do.   Important need of Adderral for me is that is slows me down MENTALLY so that I can properly function & think as I should in orders to focus & concentrate on very important & large amounts of work.  I was told by my doctor I was a TRUE canidate for this drug & I must agree.  I have Never been on any medication in my life.  This is the first & I am 51 years old.

349$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/8/2013 12:39:46 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$2$5$I only took adderall for about four months before I had to stop. It worked wonders of my focus is school and controlled my hyperactivity really well for the most part, but the side effects were just too much. Heart palpitations, no appetite whatsoever and nausea, but the worst by far was the anxiety. I would have four or five panic attacks a week just from tiny things like homework, and it drove me crazy. I ended up switching medications a couple months ago, and I'm doing much better now. These meds work great but DO NOT take them if you have a fast heart rate to begin with or are already prone to worrying/anxiety.

368$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/20/2013 3:50:55 PM$Reviewer: head injury, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Taking Adderall (generic)10mg 2st month and 20 mg 2nd month I begain losing my hair and my eyelashes were falling out (quite noticeable).  I stopped using it for a a couple of months (in between used ritalin [generic not as effective with focus and concentration] and my eyelashes grew back and my hair was not back to where it was before I started taking aderall but it stopped thinning, I was having nightmares and evil dreams, my eyes were so dried that I would wake up in pain in the middle of the night and have to put eye drops in, constipation, and racing thoughts.  I started taking the NAME BRAND Adderall a few months afterwards because I thought maybe the side effects were from the fillers because I am very sensitive to some medications.  I was able to concentrate and focus and become a normal person but again, slowly but surely, my eyelashes started to fall out and my eyes were dry but not as bad as on the generic brand--the dry eyes I could have tolerated, but I had to stop the Adderall or lose my hair on my head and eyelashes. Aside from the hair loss, I would have stayed on the NAME BRAND Adderall.  It was like I had chemotherapy and my hair was falling out.
369$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/14/2013 6:21:24 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$While I was initially skeptical of taking this medication because of my professional life (I'm an active-duty commissioned officer in the United States Air Force) I must admit that this mdication has changed my life. Not only was this medication life-changing, it only took hours for me to realize the bennifits of the treatment in terms of subsidence of my ADHD symptoms. While others have experienced problems with Adderall and its generic forms, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone suffering with serious, life-altering ADHD symptoms (as I was) consult your primary care physican or mental health care provider and see if this is an option for you. Believe me, I understand the challenges associated with both the stigma associated with ADHD generally and this medication specifically, but I promise that if this treatment is as effective for you as it was for me you'll kick yourself for waiting so long to try it (just like I did)!

381$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/28/2013 5:21:33 PM$Reviewer: [email protected], 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I was raised in a verbal
column2: physical
column3: sexual abused drug & alcohol addicted environment. My depression started at an early age. I had my first child on my 18th birthday & my second 18 months later. I had cervical cancer & had a partial hysterectomy @ age 26. In 2003 @ the age of 15 my only son was killed in a horrific alcohol related auto accident. My brother was the driver.

column1: I lost interest in everything.I lost everything.I cut myself off from even my best friend. I turned to drugs & alcohol(which I swore to NEVER do after the life I endured)for about 3 yrs. YES I wanted to die
column2: but never once thought of suicide. One day I just decided I had enough & quit all the nonsense. I did not seek help until 7 yrs after his death. I am now 43. Since I was a teen I noticed I had problems concentrating
column3: seeing things through to the end
column4: lack of interest. Daily headaches
column5: some leading to migraine. Multiple projects going at once. Occasional panic attacks & anxiety. I am so O.C.D. about certain things that I get on my own nerves. The panic attacks & anxiety have progressed over the years so I take xanax as well.  After trying several anti depressants that NEVER worked. & after seeing the results my daughter had with the Adderall
column6: I asked to try it. It has made such a difference in my life. I can actually concentrate long enough to complete what I start. I have found my passion for my art again. All this time & All the different medications I have tried
column7: people tell me it is a miracle cure for me & can attest to the fact that I feel like a NORMAL human being for once in my life..........I am extremely scared to death of this medication though.... I NEVER want to go back to whoever I was before Adderal Yet I don't want to become dependant on it & have to take it forever....rock & a hard place on this one...It is only thing I have found that actually works yet the aspect of the methamphetamine scares me. "

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$4$"I was treated for major depression and anxiety disorders for many years
column3: with ADHD being a secondary diagnosis.  My Psychiatrist turned things around out of lack of any more ideas
column4: and treated my ADHD as my primary diagnosis.

column1: The results have been amazing.  Adderall stops the anxiety and panic attacks completely.  Unfortunately
column2: it's a very short-acting medication with me
column3: so I only get 3 hours of relief from it.  Those 3 hours are worth it
column4: just to be able to breathe after many years of constant anxiety.

column1: ADHD makes it difficult for me to finish any tasks
column2: clean my house
column3: or take care of pressing paperwork. All of this leads to extreme anxiety
column4: then depression.  By treating the ADHD first
column5: I am able to focus more
column6: get some things done
column7: and the anxiety and depression over it all lessens.

column1: Dependence is definitely an issue... you must be careful to take it only as directed.  I take it every other day or so
column2: when I need to focus
column3: and trying not to become dependent. When I do take it every day
column4: I can feel myself needing it more often
column5: as the anxiety gets worse.

column1: It's not perfect
column2: but I finally have some relief from depression and anxiety after 20 years."

421$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/19/2012 11:44:55 AM$Reviewer: kris, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Before getting diagnosed and taking medication, my life was difficult and stressful.  I'm in graduate school and ever since I was younger I always had to study 2-4 times harder than everyone else just to get the same grade.  I was constantly losing everything, forgetting what I had been doing, and forgetting important things/events.  Now I've been taking a generic adderall and my life is so much easier.  I have spent less time studying and am finally able to organize things without getting distracted every 5 min.  Adderall is not good for everyone with ADHD and different treatments are available.  After my experience on medication, I would recommend that people with ADHD at least try some sort of medication.  All of my friends who have ADD/ADHD take medication and are just fine.  There are some side effects, but those are generally mild and go away after some time.  All in all, adderall has helped me a lot in graduate school, and I don't think I would be able to finish without it.

column1: 427$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/8/2012 10:02:33 AM$Reviewer: rewindmind
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Adderall has helped me focus and actually complete a task or a 'to do' list. Can't believe what a difference it makes. My husband used to 'poo-poo' me...you are lazy
column3: just focus
column4: why can't you get anything done? I thought I was losing my mind. Was tested for ADD/ADHD by a psychiatric doctor who said I was anxious and depressed and prescribed Xanax....that made me sleepy and more disconnected.

column1: Finally found a nurse practitioner who recognized my symptoms right away. Sitting in her office
column2: I couldn't even keep my feet/legs still....always felt as if I needed to be doing something!! Within three days
column3: I couldn't believe the difference. I can focus at work
column4: I can listen to a conversation without having my mind race at all the 'things' I need to complete. Just wish I would have had this in college...a lot of my professors thought I was just a scatterbrain...

column1: One of the best commercials on TV was my ah-ha moment. A woman is sitting in a conference room--in a meeting with many others. The camera focuses on her face and she has thoughts racing through her mind
column2: the announcer says...""her mind is like a television that can't find the right channel"" shows constantly changing channels/commercials...Oh my...that is me...!! I knew I needed to find someone to help me. If this sounds like you...search until you find a health care provider that will listen. The first doc I saw
column3: made me think there was something seriously wrong with me
column4: even after all the ADHD tests. The Nurse Practitioner diagnosed me at the first visit.

column1: I have no issues with this medication
column2: no shaking or nervousness...the opposite effect actually. One complaint
column3: it is amphetamine  salts...there is a 'salty' taste in my mouth--occasionally. I drink lots of water during the day
column4: that seems to help. "

446$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/5/2012 3:36:05 AM$Reviewer: If I only knew, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$As a child I never really knew that i had a short attention span. I've always had a hard time in school, but I really noticed it whenever I got into college. No matter how much I studied I couldn't seem to retain any information. About a year ago I went to my doctor and found out I have ADD. I never knew I had it until I looked back at my childhood and all the way to me now as an adult. I was put on adderall 20mg twice a day my life actually became normal. For the first time in my life I actually heard a clock ticking while talking to family. My ability to stay focused and on task was just the best feeling in the world. My life has very organized and I can hold interest in studying, my work, as well as my social life. The only downfall about adderall was that it had an extreme supression of my appetite and I had no extra weight to lose. After I would come down off of my doseage I get very irritable, not sure if it's a side effect from the drug or the fact I work 3rd shift as a police officer and rarely sleep good. But overall this has been a blessing to me and my ability to do better at work and at home. If I only had this when I was a young kid and in school I believe my grades would have been out of this world!
447$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/3/2012 9:31:32 PM$Reviewer: sclark89, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$2$5$server heart burn
448$Condition: Other$10/2/2012 4:05:45 PM$Reviewer: cloud9, 55-64 Female  (Patient) $3$3$4$I have adult diagnosed ADD. Was unable to take concerta-thought I was having a heart attack within an hour of my first dose. Doc then tried wellbrutin-did not work.  Next-vyvanse-no results.  Started on adderall. Developed the worst case of dry mouth that took over 4 mos. to clear up (after stopping adderall). Started adderall again to see if  it will work for me. Two days in at 30 mg/da & the dry mouth is raging even with a high dose of nystatin, salt rinses, baking soda rinses & every other suggestion I got professionally & from others who have suffered with dry mouth. It is on par with shingles. If anyone has the answer to dry mouth I will try ANYTHING.
449$Condition: Other$10/1/2012 3:45:39 AM$Reviewer: missfacts808080, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have major depressive disorder and am a parent and get suicidle a lot. Adderall saved my life by getting me out of bed, motivation, and look forward to things. I have adhd as well and brain injury so it was  a life saver.euphoria for two years and last two no euphoria..when you don't have it one day instant depression and sleep and eat..Whenever suicidal I would take 30mg(90) a day was my dose and i'm 90 pounds thats how bad my depression is.take it with tyrosine and baking soda and water(30 min before)..lasts only 4 hours and grind your teeth and you don't want to sleep on it because you actually are doing things constantly...unfort. my dr put me on vyvanse... Don't get on that med if you were on adderall it will put you to sleep not joking and antisocial...
450$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/25/2012 11:56:24 PM$Reviewer: honeygirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I am prescribed Adderal 20mg per day In July I began taking the generic form D Amphetamine Salt Combo for cost effectiveness.  I was drug tested and the results showed positive for 97% D Methamphetamine isonomer and 3% L Methamphetamine isonomer. 4872 Amphetamine and 1872 Methamphetamine. I have researched and came to the conclusion that the generic DAmphetamine Salt Combo is the causitive factor compared to the Amphetamine(Adderal). I need documentation to support to save my licensure. My employment agency has my current prescription on file stating Adderal 20mg (generic ok). Please assist. I found no clinical difference between brand and generic and the efficacy is amazing.

453$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/29/2012 7:36:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I've been prescribed 20mg of Adderall IR 3 times daily since I was 15, and I'm almost 20 now. Up until a year ago, it helped A LOT. I suddenly got good grades, more social, and felt great about myself. This past year, I noticed it wasn't giving me the same awesome effects. So, I started taking half of one extra, for that extra boost. Half of one became 4. Yes, I was taking 7 to 8 a day. This went on for about 9 months. My seasonal depression turned into major depressive disorder and I'm diagnosed with general anxiety disorder, chronic insomnia, major depression, mild schizophrenia, and amphetamine psychosis. Moral of my story: If you enjoy becoming addicted to a drug, seeing and hearing stuff, paranoid, depressed, aggressive, and losing everyone close to you, go for it. For everyone else, DO NOT TRY/USE ADDERALL!!! And if you do, for god's sake, DO NOT ABUSE IT! YOU'LL BECOME MENTALLY CRAZY.
454$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/28/2012 1:01:43 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD (not ADHD) in early August 2012 when I finally decided to get checked out for it
column2: and I'm taking 10mg twice daily. The pros: I am now less ""socially awkward""
column3: I'm more motivated and concentrated
column4: it boosts my mood (which is a HUGE plus considering I have chronic depression)
column5: I feel confident in my abilities to do things
column6: and I enjoy things I once never enjoyed
column7: which was just about everything. The cons: weight loss (I don't realize I'm not eating because it depletes your appetite)
column8: strange ""crawling""/ itching sensation when I begin to come down from it at night (anyone else with this sensation? It's not listed anywhere as far as side effects go)
column9: almost impossible to fall asleep at night if I take it too late in the day.

column1: Although the cons may seem like more than the pros
column2: the cons are very tolerable and can be relieves such as taking a non habit forming sleep aid (Zzzquil works great!) and if you absolutely aren't hungry while taking it
column3: drink an ensure shake once a day or take vitamins daily to ensure you don't become malnourished
column4: (butter pecan flavored ensure tastes pretty good). It also has a habit of causing your body to develop a tolerance
column5: so if you want to avoid taking massive doses in the future
column6: I recommend going a day or two (or three!) without taking it. Specifically on days where you don't have to accomplish anything. This (should) help prevent developing a tolerance and make sure that you get the full effect. Overall
column7: I am very
column8: VERY happy with this medication."

column1: 468$Condition: Other$8/15/2012 12:07:03 AM$Reviewer: kissmissrabbit
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$4$4$I had been diagnosed multiple times with manic depression
column3: anxiety
column4: psychosis etc etc
column5: and yet none of the medications seemed to help me overall with my mood and motivation. Then recently after being diagnosed with fibromyalgia
column6: I was referred to a psychologist for ADD testing which can be affiliated with fibromyalgia. I was then diagnosed with ADD and was put on 10 mg of adderall twice daily. It has done absolute wonders for me. Taking it early enough in the morning and once again around noon keeps me from being up too late. My mood is always heightened and I am very motivated and not overwhelmed. The only downfall is that of a rare side effect
column7: which would be once the adderall starts to wear off
column8: I get the sensation of bugs crawling all over my skin. It scared me at first because my first impression was that it could be bed bugs or scabies
column9: but after both were ruled out
column10: I learned it is a rare and unspoken side effect of this drug
column11: which has been controlled by a low dosage of atarax
column12: which is an antihistamine primarily. and the nice thing about it is that it helps me sleep at night! Anyone else seem to have that bizarre sensation once it gets later in the day and the adderall is wearing off?

column1: 469$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/10/2012 2:32:43 PM$Reviewer: Donah
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$It makes my life run much smoother
column3: I have to multi-task during my day and it makes it possible
column4: Prior to getting on this medication I would have 6 projects started and could never seem to stay on any one thing long enough to finish.I have had no side effects except from time to time I get shakey hands for a short time. Its a wonder drug for me.

column1: 470$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/10/2012 12:50:58 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits
column2: usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue
column3: but that being said
column4: it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However
column5: every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life
column6: so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

column1: 471$Condition: Other$8/7/2012 12:52:36 AM$Reviewer: Stormy48
column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$5$"I have suffered from depression for most of my adult life but the last two years I was lucky to get up dut to family drama and I had

column4: although
column5: not used for ADHD
column6: for me
column7: allowed me to feel like I wanted to get up and live my life. I have only been on it for less than 6 months but I feel it saved my life by giving me the kick in the butt someone else might get from coffee. Nothing worked for me
column8: complete loss of energy until I started the Adderall Oral. It is mentioned as a treatment for severe depression and I refuse to feel bad for using a medication that made me want to live again. It's not magic
column9: I still have to think positive
column10: not focus on the negative but I'm so thankful this medication serves more than one ailment."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"I began a new job that I was fully capable of doing
column3: but was tired of stuggling and having no accomplishment.  I would bounce from task to task
column4: and realized that this was the first job that I had to sit and focus.  Having started this med
column5: I can focus
column6: finish what I start without feeling like I have to move or do something else.  In meetings I can remember what was said
column7: because I actually pay attention
column8: I'm not checking my phone or drawing.  Even my coworkers have noticed that I am much more ""quiet"" (they don't know my condition).  The best part...my head is quiet.  When I first started this med

column11: and that is the best part.  It's not pieces at a time are completed

column15: just a better more pulled together you shines through."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I've been taking adderall xr 30mg once daily (as needed) for over 2 years now and it works amazing. The only drawback to this medication is it causes constant spotting. Ive been spotting every day since I started the medication even if I don't take it on the weekends or if I'm on vacation the spotting is still present. It's a small price to pay for a medication that ""normalizes"" your cognitive functioning. "

column1: 500$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/1/2012 11:14:25 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$For over a.decade I was incorrectly diagnosed as having a serious anxiety disorder. During this time
column2: I was treated with xanax(alprazolam) tablets which
column3: as directed
column4: I took 3x a.day. Over these years I was at a dose of up to 6 mg per day. I tried one time foolishly to just stop taking it and was put in the hospital the following day
column5: unaware that I was going through serious and potentially life-threatening issues. Then

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out
column3: as well as lowering my impulsivity since it gives me that second reaction time before I say something or do something I shouldn’t. The only side effect I’ve ever noticed is that I do have a decrease of appetite when on the pill and once it wears off I’m ravenously hungry. However
column4: once on the medication for 5 days or so that symptom has gone away and I end up hungry again. Overall I would recommend it to anyone with ADD or ADHD.

546$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/12/2012 1:14:38 PM$Reviewer: BreezieBoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$To begin, I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors, but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was, I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So, a few weeks ago, a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years, but stopped taking it, and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half, and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so, I then found myself reading normally again, I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks, I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things, and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed, no problem, at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all, but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy, I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours, and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis, or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone, but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time. 
547$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/10/2012 9:04:53 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... I once was at a standstill in College, always wanting class to be over, never paying attention, ditracted and over stimulated by the smallest noises; I would find myself obsessing about the tapping of a pencil, rather than the professor. As a result, my grades suffered, self-esteem suffered,  and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.

column1: 573$Condition: Other$1/8/2012 12:00:20 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I knew growing up that i had a problem with focusing & motivation for anything. i caused trouble in school to make the days more exciting or i would count repeatedly in my head & obsess on objects
column2: instead of paying attention. (i also suffer from diagnosed OCD)after high school
column3: i found myself breaking up my family & the life we had going for us
column4: just so i could live my life on the edge with alcohol
column5: pills
column6: & sex. all because i was bored with life & i needed the adrenaline rush to stimulate my mind & body. i was officially diagnosed with ADD without hyperactivity at the age of 23 & started off with Ritalin
column7: which didn't even touch my ADD. i'm finally taking what i wanted all along.. Adderall. i now take 30mg twice a day & it has made all the difference in the world. i can finally focus on tasks at hand
column8: i have the motivation & energy to get things done
column9: and people & things don't irritate me as badly as they did before. side effects? it does give you an addictive ""high"" that's supposedly comparible to cocaine
column10: so i do see the potential for abuse. it causes insomnia for me if taken too late in the day or if i double my dosage
column11: but i can take my next dose that morning & run like i had a full-night's sleep. i was 143lbs when i started taking Adderall (which is the biggest i have EVER been in my life
column12: due to eating for comfort after the death of my sister) but i am now 126lbs after 3-4 months of being on Adderall. i literally have no appetite anymore.. unhealthy & i know this BUT i honestly love seeing my lbs drop. also makes my heart race at times & can be somewhat alarming
column13: especially since my heart rate is on the high side anyways. the major issue i have had (that i haven't seen from other users) is my OCD is worse than ever now. maybe i'm focusing TOO much & that triggers my OCD? other than that
column14: i think the benefits outweigh the side effects. thank you Adderall. sorry for the long story
column15: but i hope my experience helps & someone else can relate :)"

column1: 576$Condition: Other$12/27/2011 10:52:31 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was diagnosed with ADHD at age 28.  I have a history of procrastination
column2: lack of motivation
column3: organized chaos and extreme fatigue/tiredness accompanied by worrying and anxiety.  I was treated for anxiety to start
column4: pristiq.  Once
column5: under control
column6: My doctor started with a low dose of adderrall increased by 5 mg a day until I reached the point where I felt focused
column7: locked in on my work and time seemed to fly by.  I reached 20 mg and maintained for 30 days.  The results where amazing.  I can't believe I went my whole childhood without this diagnoses.  Anyways
column8: upon my evaluation my doctor ""upgraded"" me to vyvanse stating that it has a cleaner smoother release and I should benefit more.  The first day I felt like I was on cocaine.  I had lock jaw
column9: grinding my teeth and felt like i was high which kept coming and going.  I gave it 2 weeks and had to quit.  My doctor switched me back to extended release adderrall and I'm symptom free.  My ADHD is under control and I'm functioning much better at work and home.  Eating was one of my coping mechanisms before so the decreased appetite was a welcome.  To combat
column10: I keep lots of fruit
column11: yogurt
column12: veggies and nuts on hand.  My general physician introduced me to a book called ""Driven to Distraction"" which helped me understand my condition
column13: the different variations
column14: as well as ways to combat.  For me
column15: exercise and to do lists are my keys to success.  Recently
column16: I tried stopping pristiq to see if my anxiety was just a result of the ADHD but found I have a combination condition.  I wouldn't have understood this without reading the book so I highly recommend in addition to adderrall xr. "

596$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/2/2011 2:49:01 PM$Reviewer: Towlie, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$2$Here is the issue. ADHD Im diagnosed with by some phychiatrist. Other phychiatrist i have been evaluated by say i don't have it. They all have MD after there names so who is correct and who's incorrect??...I've been off and on adderall for 8 years. Im 28 years old. Yes it helps me concentrate. Yes, it helps motivate me. Yes, it even makes me feel better about myself...however adderall is extremly addictive, so thats the biggest issue with it. This is a med that is in high demand among society and can kill if it falls into the wrong persons hands. Drug users feel great euphoria and energy when they use it, simply put; thats why they use it. Prescription drug abuse is sky rocketing like never before. So parents keep that in mind.---SO-- The fact remains adderall helps a ton with certain people. If you plan to take it here are a few tips (not that im a dr.) 1)If you have a prior substance abuse problem, FORGET adderall 2)Take it exactly how directed by MD. 3)Keep it in a place thats secure, kids know ALL about adderall. 4)Keep an eye on your pulse, BP, and heart rate. The worst side effect i've expericed is becoming anxious on it. I am just trying to give a down to earth review, and i hope it helps some of you.

I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg
column2: 2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one
column3: if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to
column4: you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly
column5: god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though
column6: it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them
column7: but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother
column8: it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also
column9: dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each
column10: while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each."

610$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/21/2011 3:38:36 AM$Reviewer: SpeedFiend, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have ADHD and I am prescribed 50mg vyvanse each day. It works well and I love it. Unfortunately, I love it so much I take well over the recommended daily dose. I have built my tolerance up to 350mg per day, and it makes me feel awesome. About a half hour after I pop them, my heart will start pounding and hurt incredibly. Often, when remaining still, my legs or arms will go numb. I feel dizzy and weak all the time. I will also get severe chest pain and back aches. I do not sleep, and if I do, I sleep at the most one hour during the day. Concerning eating habits, I don't eat much and have lost a lot of weight. My withdrawals are hell, and unexplainably miserable. I feel sad, tired, hungry, bored, and hopeless. I will admit that these pills possess most of my thoughts. If I don't have multiple pills on me at all times, I feel very uncomfortable. Therefore, I at least need to have pills on me for the next time I need to take some.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I started Adderall-XR after my doctor ruled that I was ADHD

column4: depression
column5: anxiety
column6: violence
column7: etc.

column11: centered and a lot more accessible to psychological treatment which lasted almost 9 years. I am a much better person for doing the treatment
column12: I continue to take Adderall. It is the only ""psychological"" drug that I now take and was misdiagnosed for over 30 years. Work with your doctor to tweak this drug
column13: to the just right amount - you'll be glad you did. I am just one of the many that lived through a horrid
column14: tumultuous life in regards to the rape
column15: upbringing
column16: violence
column17: etc.
column18: and just trying to find the real me. A compassionate
column19: loving
column20: understanding and forgiving me buried deep under the ugly layers  of hell. I wrote a letter to my doctor and expressed the aforementioned and that he could read it to any patient that he desired - if he felt it would ""connect"" with that patient. My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions
column22: get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly
column23: only human - it is our nature. Anyone desiring to discuss what any medications have done for me were always welcome but you cannot base your results on someone else. You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. That is where your trusted physician comes in and although they may be right on the money regarding one drug that works for you beware - they do not always remember all the drugs you are taking so that is where the patient must be vigilant
column24: especially when being referred from specialist to another doctor or specialist. I bring an up-to-date prescription printout to any new doctors as a new patient. Thank You -"

column1: 669$Condition: Other$9/6/2011 1:57:19 PM$Reviewer: FlyByTurkey
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"Where to begin... I decided to start seeing a therapist when my anger and irritability issues were having an impact on everyone around me including my children and my girlfriend and her daughter. I have always had these issues but I can also be a very fun person too. After a few visits with the therapist and asking her for help with the anger among other issues including concentration. She gave me a test for ADD and failed miserably. Went to the Dr. and he prescribed 20mg Prozac a day and 10mg of Adderall twice daily. WOW! Slap in the face and one happy son of a gun. For a week it was weird because of adjusting to the meds. Not much sleep and felt foggy and strange but that went away. After a couple of weeks I upped the Prozac to 40mg a day. Worked a lot better for me (28 year old male 215lbs).  I tried not taking the Adderall on the weekends but I just got distant and irritable. I thought it was the Prozac so I tried stopping it and just taking Adderall. Nope
column3: that didn't work. I got easily car sick and real irritable. So just went back on both at the same time until I could talk to my Dr. about switching or something. I decided to try upping the Adderall by splitting on in half and taking 15mg in the morning and 5mg later in the day. I felt a lot better on a higher dose. I decided to save up a few extras and try to take 20mg in the morning and 20mg later in the day. WOW! That is a lot different feeling. I can really concentrate now and I actually get up and do things and finish them instead of just wanting to but can't seem to just do it. My girlfriend (now my wife) is loving it. I taught her daughter how to ride a bike
column4: cleaned up the garage and organized it (which has been a dump for a long time) and I cleaned up my office (boss has been on my butt for a while). Best part is
column5: I love that I am a person now. Cure for depression and anxiety: antidepressant + Adderall. Antidepressant to numb the pain and

column1: Adderall to get your butt up and enjoy life!"

column1: 696$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/31/2011 12:21:17 PM$Reviewer: Eiheiken
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"This medication has helped my ADD tremendously especially in the work place. Some side effects though more so from coming off of it when I take drug holidays they are usually spent sleeping on the couch. When I take it though I do very well and usually by the end of the day sleeping is not a problem. However it used to be a problem when I took the XR version. Now I take the plain old fashion immediate release tablets 30mg at a time. Once in the morning and then in the afternoon or I break my afternoon in half to make an additional 15mg available to take closer to 4:00pm but no later that a way I can stretch it out if its a longer day. At this dosage/prescription I don't suffer from insomnia as the drug tends to wear off my quickly at the end of the day and then I can sleep. Some side effects like feeling speedy and shaky can happen but are usually mild if not somewhat pleasant anyhow. I've been taking this dosage for years and I still say there is an advantage to having ADD. One is being able to take Adderall as I can usually run circles around my co-workers. When I'm on my medicine its like my personality lights up a little more and I stay focused and on task with little negative side effects. After so many years my body is addicted to it though hence the major withdrawal I go through on the couch on drug holidays. But if you don't mind being lazy and sleepy during those time I think it is well worth it all. Adderall is 4 amphetamine salts in one tablet so its like the inventors of this drug just said to themselves ""well one of these stimulants has to hit the right spot"" and then they marketed it with the clever name ADD ERALL. So for what ever reason it does work well for ADD. The only other drug I haven't tried for ADD is Desoxyn (methamphetamine) I guess I have been afraid to even ask for it just by the stigma that goes along with the name. So my experience with these drugs is well worth mentioning if you want an honest and thorough review.   "

column1: 713$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/4/2011 8:13:02 PM$Reviewer: Nick
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But
column3: I began to feel ""out of it"" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to ""think clearly"". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get ""soaked"" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"I'm a college student majoring in electrical engineering and I was diagnosed with adhd when I was 12 years old: i was one angry and hyper kid! Anyways I was perscribed to Strattera as I entered middle school beginning with 20 mg. After seven years this medication was working miracles with a few ups and downs here and there... well that's the good part.

column1: The bad news is the positive effects literally ""shut off"" in a matter of two weeks this past winter. I was back to that child who could barely read a couple of pages in a book
column2: let alone prepare for exams and papers as a college freshman. It was terrible: I lost great relationships with friends and family
column3: suffered from depression and constant unpredictable mood swings
column4: and the list goes on and on. Even with an increase in 80 mg the pills were useless unless two or more were consumed a day.

column1: I talked to my doctor about the problem and he said drastic neurochemical changes may have built a tolerance against the strattera
column2: which is farely common with that particular drug. To compensate
column3: he perscribed 20 mg of Adderall to take with 100 mg of Strattera a day
column4: and let me tell you
column5: the waters have settled and the sun shines again! Complete clarity and focus
column6: anxiety almost nonexistent
column7: and I feel back to my normal self. Only thing is that my appetite has diminished quite a bit and I have the libido of a neutered camel
column8: but those don't outweigh the fact that life is GREAT again. I could see where an addiction could transpire because it's pretty much altered cocaine that's approved by the fda
column9: but really it all comes down to you: ""can I survive w/o downing 16 pills today?"""
