column1:
1511$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$7/14/2008 1:47:08 AM$Reviewer: Truth (Patient) $3$2$2$I believe I have a mix of hyperactivity and inattentivness.. I'm easily distracted, like to be on the move (as if driven by a motor), its hard to stay on task, I zone-out/daydream here & there, I find it hard to be motivated, especially in school (unless I am genuinely interested in the material & feel it really applies to my life). I procrastinate, can be quite disorganized, and stress out because of this all! Thats when I dont take Adderall.  Only somewhat effective because the tablets tend to wear off as the day progresses which results in irritability, they initially get me down to business. I'd hoped that side-effecrs wouldnt apply to be but well in reality they do. this drug really is no joke and should be taken seriously because of its habit-forming tendency. i dont like the idea of depending on a substance to do things i used to be able to do without it. true, those things were harder to do before Adderall, but: when i would go a day or 2 without it, or just be on a lower dose, i found that the fatigue that set in as a result (side-effect) made those things harder than it had been before ever taking the Adderall! Essentially Adderall had picked me & dropped me lower than before =/ I don't want to go back off of it, however i do want my genuine self back, the one that isn't so serious and annoyed. high blood pressure is another thing to look out for. this can raise it. it makes me tense at times. But if you're like me you'll like it AT FIRST. It helps me work & i mean efficiently, but I don't always need this stuff.. maybe when i have a paper due but not when just hanging with friends. i made it without Adderall but it wasnt easy & it especially isnt now that i've been on it. Learning about ADD helps me understand myself better & discover under what conditions i'm best able to work. this'll make a difference in whether I decide to continue it. I of course respect that the severity of the ADD in any case also must be addressed. Dosage is also very important.
1512$Condition: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day$7/11/2008 2:59:08 AM$Reviewer: wetwonderland, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I suffer from chronic fatigue. I take 40 mgs when I get up and sometimes another 20 in the afternoon.  It has made my life so much better.  It is not perfect, but I'd rather take it than feel like I did before.  When my new Dr. said she wouldn't be able to prescribe it, I cried.  My quality of life was at stake.  I changed doctors.

I started taking adderall to help me with my school work about 7 months ago.  Before the medicine I procrastinated
column2: could not finish a projects
column3: was disinterested
column4: and unmotivated.  When I take this medication I shed all of those characteristics. I am able to study for about 5-8 hours straight and obtain all the information. I am in my senior year of college and thought I could use a push to finish the hard classes. I became interested in learning; I grasped concepts easily
column5: and became level headed and rational.  I will say though
column6: there is a huge downside.  I got bad headaches
column7: lost ten pounds
column8: blacked out frequently for a second when I stood up
column9: chest pains
column10: and numbness in my hands. When on the medication
column11: I lost my connection to emotion and was very irritable.  I tended to be cold and distant.  I know this medicine works but I did not want to put my body through the side effects any longer.

column1: I have stopped taking this due to the person I was becoming.  It takes more discipline for me to study and stay focused but at least I feel like my true self.
This drug is habit forming. I thought I could not get an A on a test without it
column2: but I did and I can.  Plus now when I get an A it is more rewarding knowing it was all me who earned
column3: not the adderall.

column1:
1515$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/26/2008 12:54:20 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$2$Freshman yr of college i was diagnosed with ADD, the Inattentive kind. My experience with Adderall has been a love/hate relationship. I started on 20mg in a.m. & 10mg in p.m. It gave me more energy, made me mentally sharper & I felt normal & happier since I was more able to communicate & think clearly. I was happy.. at first. Then I noticed I could stay up WAY late. Then I'd sleep in & miss the classes I'd finally begun thoroughly doing the work for. Also, friends pointed out Id become irritable & mean at times. I agreed but was upset because of all the good adderall was doing for me otherwise. The tablets wore off later in the day, causing my moods. My prescriber recommended a higher dose, I agreed & I liked it, I was focused on getting my stuff done. STILL, I was.. cold, emotions were distant. IMPORTANT: check before you start this if theres a history of addictions to substances like alchohol etc in your family as this can really be HABIT-FORMING, as in my case. Also, Adderall doesnt allow refills. This was prob when back from out of state college & I had insurance- coverage issues, which forced me to go off adderall. DIFFICULT. I was SO tired, moreso than EVER before. felt like a moody addict & sad & like doing NOTHING.2nd day with no Adderall in my system, woke up during the night & threw up. Horrible & bizarre. BE CAREFUL, listen to your body's signs if on it. Try keeping lowest dose possible. Off adderall, I still had a job to get & chores ETC when just functioning was a task. Gained back the weight i'd lost, plus a few. After that I felt better each day, but back to my spacey, scattered & anxious self again. Caffiene helped, in big amts. Insurance is fixed, I caved & am back on it. They say you'll feel like a different person. Maybe, I feel my old Adderall self returning, more focused but mean. My family has noticed. Mom said i'm not my old self. & I fear I'm becoming dependent again. Im taking lower doses & may switch to Dexedrine or Adderall XR. Think.

column1: 1536$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/6/2008 6:26:16 PM$Reviewer: brett
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$5$"I'm 20 and in my first year of college. I was diagnosed with ADD in 6th Grade for my lack of ability to concentrate
column3: I was/am quite the day dreamer. The Doc put me on 5mg Adderall XR I believe. My freshman year the dose was increased to 10mg. At the time I didn't know fully how it effected me
column4: all I knew is that it made me want to throw desks at the teachers that irritated me
column5: and that I was unhappy and pissed of for no reason. I switched from adderall to stratera
column6: then to ritali LA
column7: but I prefered not taking anything because of how they effected me. In January I started back on Adderal XR @ 15mg and I told myself that it's worth the sacrifice to have good grades and be able to focus
column8: but I  now that I am older I am more aware of how it effects me. My grades immediately went from C's to high B's and the Highest gpa I've had in years. I quit taking it when I realized that it was destroying my life in the following ways:

column1: -Extreme OCD behavior
-Depression
-AntiSocial behavior
-Muscular twitches
-Dependence
-Most of all
column2: Loss of identity

column1: Naturally I am a outgoing person
column2: I love people
column3: I'm easy going
column4: and always have a smile on my face but Adderall flipped my world upside down. I would not recommend any parent putting their child on this medication under any circumstance
column5: if you care about them at all. ADD is not a disorder
column6: it is just a way to classify people who function on a higher/different level than the average population. ADD is a gift that our society hasn't learned how to handle.

column1: My recommendation to parents would be to look for and encourage the abilities and gifts your child has
column2: and be as supportive as you possibly can. They need to know that they are brilliant
column3: creative
column4: and gifted. The reason ADD'ers can't focus well is because they are constantly thinking! What kind of world do we live in when thinking needs to be medicated?!"

column1: 1537$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/3/2008 6:16:25 PM$Reviewer: brightdreamer
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$3$I was taking this for ADD without hyperactivity. It seemed to help at first

column4: keeping up with tasks
column5: and getting more things done. However

column9: overreacting to stress
column10: crying at every little thing
column11: snapping at friends and family... I really damaged a relationship with one friend
column12: sadly. Upon talking to my doctor

column14: which is exactly what I was trying to treat with the depression medication! She offered to put me on a mood stabilizer drug as well
column15: but I said just take me off the Adderall and try something else for the ADD rather than adding another drug to fix its side effects. I'm trying Strattera now
column16: we'll see how it works. The drug did what it was supposed to do
column17: but honestly
column18: my ADD isn't bad enough to warrant taking a drug with this kind of side effect.

1540$Condition: Other$4/28/2008 1:39:04 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$I first saw a doctor when I was 17 yrs. old seeking treatment for depression and constant lethargy. However
column2: after answering a short questionnaire
column3: I was diagnosed with ADD
column4: and have been on Adderall (which was helpful at first) ever since. Now
column5: I've been on the medication so long that I can't remember who
column6: or how I was before I started taking it. In addition to causing my mild OCD to become full blown routine-altering OCD
column7: I find that the medication increases my irritability 10 fold (especially when it's wearing off
column8: and especially within the last year). I'm not sure if it is the medication or simply life circumstances that is now causing me severe depression
column9: extreme lack of motivation
column10: and weird and very sudden mood swings. I have also experienced more common side effects
column11: like jaw clenching
column12: tension
column13: dizziness
column14: and increased heart rate. I would like to try to stop taking the medication now
column15: but feel I am dependent on it and am afraid of the withdrawal effects. I worry about the long term side effects that I may experience from taking this drug for so long
column16: and the misery that it may/may not be causing me presently. I would NEVER consider putting a child on this medication.

column1: 1541$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/27/2008 3:04:38 PM$Reviewer: Cat-mom
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$4$"I have taken a low dose of adderall for about five years
column3: and it has changed my life.

column1: My ability to think ahead
column2: anticipate and avoid problems has dramatically improved. My abilty to articulate myself improves dramatically on adderal – especially with a low dose.  I can understand the consequences of my actions with a clarity that I wish I had earlier in life J My over-all attention span has dramatically improved in the last five years – and it remains significantly higher even on days when I choose not to take adderall. To me
column3: that is amazing. Tasks I once found painful
column4: I can now do quickly an efficiently with patience and perfect detail – even off adderall. A large part of why I think I see a lot of improvement is not just the medication
column5: but also all the other things I do to combat ADHD.

column1: When I need to learn something new (e.g. a software program at work) adderal helps me quickly learn and absorb the new information
column2: and remember facts. It is a dramatic change from my past abilities.

column1: When I first started taking the drug
column2: I had heart palpitations. It is definitely hard on the heart. BUT then I started to add regular
column3: gentle but rigorous aerobic exercise to my routine (which
column4: btw
column5: is a non-prescription treatment for ADHD)
column6: my heart became stronger
column7: more conditioned than before and the palpitations stopped. My resting hr is 45 bpm
column8: and my blood pressure is ideal
column9: or close to it. This also will solve any insomnia problems.

column1: I recommend this drug – FOR THE RIGHT PERSON. Fact is we are all built differently. Which is the whole reason why drugs like this are made in the first place. Depending on your peculiarities
column2: it may not give you exactly what you need.  That doesn’t mean this drug won’t be very helpful to someone else. I look forward to the day when these types of drugs can be prescribed and monitored more accurately. "

column1: 1543$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/21/2008 11:26:17 AM$Reviewer: c_jernigan, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$My initial response to Adderall XR was great - it changed my life
column2: but then ... and there is always a ""but"" in life - the effects began to wear off and then I think that Adderall began muting my endocrine system.  In a nutshell - it significantly reduced my level of perceived anxiety. I didn't realize it
column3: but I was probably living with a ""4"" on a 1 - 10 scale for general anxiety.  Adderall brought me down to a 1 or 2.  I think that basically after a month or two my adrenaline and other things were basically either all used up
column4: or the receptor sites were burned out.  Basically there was no ""fire"" because all of the fuel had been burned up.  Also
column5: I think that I had some mild depression creeping in - I became somewhat unmotivated
column6: and really didn't want to do much physically.

column1: After about 1 year my libido dropped like a rock
column2: my testicles felt as if they had shrunken to 1/2 their normal size.  My body temperature was always low - it was routinely in the mid 96 to low 97 range.  I had no physical strength nor endurance - where I had been previously in good shape and could crank out 25 pushups at any given time
column3: I could only manage 20 or so ""girl"" pushups (supported by knees) after which time I was exhausted.  After working out
column4: I didn't feel as if I was gaining any benefit or very minor benefit
column5: almost as if I was having a muted recovery.

column1: After initially becoming more organized I began slipping back
column2: then I was maybe only 25% of my initial organization.

column1: I have stopped taking XR on a daily basis and have begun taking it only ""as needed"" - what my doctor doesn't know will not hurt him.  I think that something needs to be recharged - I am now an advocate of ""drug holidays""
column2: every other day usage
column3: or simply ""as needed"" be that at work
column4: or home.

column1: I never found myself feeling mentally addicted - but I did have brain fog for a couple of days when stepping down.
I was on 30mg/day Adderall XR - 40yo male - ~18 months.

1544$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/16/2008 7:26:13 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking the XR 20mg a day for about 6 months now and it has completely changed my life. You would have never known I had an attention problem because I was a very active teenager.  I was involved in sports, many extracuricular activities and worked since I was 16 so my mind was constantly focused on something different.  It became a problem after becoming a single mom.  I couldn't organize any thought.  If there was too much going on I couldn't focus to organize it.  I didn't pay bills, I took extreme chances, and even forgot I was a mom sometimes.  After finally confessing to my mother how i felt she suggested talking to my PCP.  He gave me the 20mg XR 6 months ago and now I feel as though I am actually living my life.  I have since fixed my finances, gotten promoted at work, and enjoy my time with my daughter so much more.  I would suggest this treament to anyone as long as their Dr. agrees.  Use caution when taking this it can be very addicting, and should not for children that have no gone through puberty.  i have lost 30 pounds since start because of the lack of appetite and amount of exercise i do.  I also have about two nights a week that i have trouble falling asleep.  over all I thank myself every day for being able to communicate how I felt.  I am finally the person I always wanted to be and never thought could be.

column1: 1562$Condition: Other$2/29/2008 1:42:29 AM$Reviewer: Miss Bonner
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I have been diagnosed with bipolar disorder along with PTSD since I was thirteen. I am now 25
column3: and I decided to try this medication perscribed by my new psychiatrist; who has rediagnosed me with ADHD.

column1: During the first day of two 30mg. tablets I did fine
column2: with the exception of a few jitters.  I wasn't sleepy or depressed as usual.  After consulting my doctor
column3: he said it was a sign that I should double my dosage.  Then came the second and third days.  I was a maniac!  I would sit for hours preforming illogical tasks that I couldn't stop; like combing my hair for 6 hours.  My eyes were dialated
column4: I ached from being tense
column5: and I also felt disconnected from the world.  I was very irritable
column6: paranoid
column7: dizzy
column8: sweating
column9: short of breath
column10: and OCD.  I couldn't fall asleep without prescription medications.  I was too anxious to even take the trash out.  I will never take stimulants of this kind again.  Afterall
column11: I know I am bipolor
column12: but the thought of removing that diagnosis gained enough of my trust to try stimulants.  I've never felt more crazy!  The days just flew by and I have no idea what I did.  Needless to say
column13: I'm looking for a new doctor."

column1: 1563$Condition: Other$2/27/2008 1:16:48 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$2$1$"I was prescribed adderall for ADD without hyperactivity 15mg 2x a day. It is very difficult to take this medicine as prescribed because it keeps me up all night and has terrible side effects. I've experienced extreme anxiety that did not exist before I started along with chest pain
column2: tightness in my chest
column3: labored breathing
column4: jaw pain/teeth clenching
column5: headaches
column6: dizziness
column7: loss of coordination etc... I've tried lowering the dose as well as raising it but still experience the same sypmtoms. I will be fine taking it if I havent had it in a few days but the come down is so terrible that I am unable to sleep properly for the next 2 days and experience a hangover so terrible that I am unable to take it again for at least 3 days. It did help me concentrate but makes me extremely antisocial and fearful of speaking in a classroom or out in public. I was not like this before I started taking it. I also have been getting terrible panic attacks so bad that I need to lay down and force myself to sleep until it passes. After I did more research on Adderall and realized it was just SYNTHETIC CRYSTAL METH in a pill form I am no longer suprised at the hell I went through. I think it's terrible that the FDA is allowing so many citizen's to become pharmaceutical speed addicts...especially when it is precribed to a child.

Finally decided to go to a doctor to see what was up. I decided to stop taking all sleeping pills beforehand. Doctor prescribes 15mg/ 2x a day (non-xr
column3: I did not want the XR as I already have a hard enough time falling asleep). After taking adderall for a few days

column1: 1569$Condition: Other$2/14/2008 8:07:52 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with ADD about 8 mnonths ago and am prescribed to Adderall 20mg 2x a day. I couldn't listen to a solid sentence someone was saying to me for the same reason. After taking adderall I worked so much more efficiently and understood a lot more. It was as if my head was pulled out of a cloud or something. I really wish I had been more aware of this condition in high school. I was always a decent student making average grades but it was very difficult for me to really understand and grasp things
column2: especially in math. I had a very appathetic attitude towards high school and my efforts to go to college were lacking...and as a result of that I still haven't gone back to school. Overall
column3: taken responsibly adderall has been 100% effective. The biggest side effect I'v experienced has been a lack of hunger. I've lost probably 20 pounds in the last 8 months. I just make sure I eat before I take it and drink nutritional shakes throughout the day.

column6: diagnosed ADHD at 5 years.

column1: As an adult
column2: my hyperactivity DECREASED
column3: while other ADD symptoms INCREASED: inattentiveness
column4: distractions
column5: severe impulsivity
column6: reckless behavior. I tried all the ADHD meds and methyphenidates do not work for me. On Dex Spansules & tabs 'til the '90s. Thanks to Dex
column7: I finished HS/college and attained a career (which didn't last).

column1: In '92
column2: p-doc took me from ADD meds to HIGH doses of SSRIs. Spun out-of-control for over a decade.

column1: Moved to IN in '02. After a couple of incidents resulting from my ADD I stopped SSRIs. Dr refused to prescr ADD meds & said she didn't ""believe"" in ADHD. She wrote Provigil for ""focus"" and a CPAP machine for sleep disorder
column2: neither did 'squat.' Hit rock-bottom 3 months ago & found a NP who prescribed Adderall XR 20 mg. It helped a TINY BIT. At my pleading
column3: she raised XR to 30mg & added a 10 mg d-amp tab to be broken in half
column4: 5 mg in AM with XR
column5: 5 mg early to mid PM.

column1: Her concern is my age. Phys health is GOOD: no heart
column2: liver
column3: kidney
column4: lung problems. Low BP all my life. Never smoked
column5: rarely drink maybe glass of wine once a month. XR is slow-starting
column6: so mornings are shot before I know it
column7: then have severe sleepy period in mid-aft. XR kicks in again around 5PM but then I hyperfocus on all the wrong things until 10-11PM
column8: when I binge & fidget until I go to sleep with xanax around 1AM.

column1: Here is my personal dx: I'm under-dosed. On Adderall XR
column2: a minimum 60mg x 2 plus 10mg D-amp x 2.

column1: Preference is Dex Spans + 5mg Dex tabs x 3.
XR's inconsistent & a rollercoaster ride."

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a 23 year old recent college graduate that has been taking Adderall Oral for the past 6 to 7 months.  I was not diagnosed with ADD/ADHD until the start of my treatment.  With this treatment I have noted some very distinct changes in my performance in college and now in my career.  I am a Mechanical Engineer in NC.  My focus at work seems to be increased but not over the top.  I finally feel that I can start a project and follow it through to the end.  Finishing the minute details that have plagued me in the past and that I have procrastinated with in the past.  I feel that Adderall oral is an effective treatment for my condition.  Although I strongly urge parents and students to take caution with using this treatment option.  I have noticed a weekly to bi-weekly occurrence of limited sleep for one to two nights.  This seems to typically happen on a Friday night and Sunday nights.  As this has continued I feel that there are some other treatments that I should attempt before settling on this one.  Also as I was diagnosed during my final semester of college with ADD/ADHD I noticed that I suddenly had more friends then the prior 5 years of college.  So parents
column3: students in college with go to extreme measures to acquire Adderall from your child. This is also becoming an increasing concern for college campuses across the nation.  Like I said before
column4: I believe
column5: this medication should be taken consistently and you shouldn't miss many treatments.  Missing treatments has made me extremely groggy and lazy.  So caution to not taking it on the weekends.  I have noticed that when I continued treatment for 7 days a week I didn't have the haze
column6: groggy and lazy feeling.  Also I reduce my dosage to half during the weekends. I hope this helps all in some manner.

column5: and depression. So i stopped using it. When i went to my doctor and told him about  it he seemed to realize that the ritalin wasn't causing the stress and other problems
column6: but it was just the the troubles of freshman year. The drug and my problems weren't actually connected. My doctor prescribed adderall for me in my sophomore year
column7: and i almost instantaneously saw the improvements
column8: faster reaction time
column9: less daydreaming
column10: and i could keep my grades up and remember my work with ease. Luckily i had parents that trusted me enough to let me keep the medication in my own place(in my room) because i was ashamed at first to have to take something to make myself better. It was as if it kind of lifted a disability completely off of my shoulders. Ive taken it all the way through college and stopped when i graduated
column11: i experienced no real withdrawal
column12: I just had to make a smooth transition which my doctor helped me with greatly. If taken in the right doses and not obsessed about it seems to be a very good help for my future and self esteem.

column1: Just realize that what you see as depression and other related things could very well be the much more stressful and much more dangerous thing called high school."

1621$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/11/2007 1:29:21 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$5$4$"ADD-no hyperactivity...but that was the only option to choose..
I've taken adderall when i was in high school and then went off the medication for about a year. During that year my grades went from A's and B's to C's or below. Its not that i wasn't a hard worker
column2: i just couldn't concentrate on school work. Its a great medicine and works if used correctly. There are a few complications with it if you take 40 mg or higher for a long period of time (i.e-years) i have read that there is a possiblity of heart complications. But if you stay at a healthy dose and don't go overboard..it works. Also
column3: adderall XR is great b/c you only have to take it once a day
column4: instead of twice a day.

column1: 1642$Condition: Other$11/27/2007 6:05:57 PM$Reviewer: $4$3$5$The main problem with Adderall is that it is extremely addictive. I started taking it to help me get through classes and work. I loved that it killed my appetite. I thought I'd be able to take it in moderation
column2: but I take it everyday now. I just feel like a happier person when I take it. But I've noticed that I am distant and easily annoyed if I take too much. Sometimes I feel that I'm on the verge of having a panic attack. If I take 15 MG a day and I eat I feel amazing. But its very easy to avoid eating and take 30 MG because you just get so much done. Im very nervous that I will become strongly addicted to the drug. Im also nervous that I will loose too much weight. Scary.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Adderall has worked very well for me. My thought process is much more organized and my ability to stay focused on a conversation and tuned into the subject at hand has improved immensely.  I have over the years tried to slow and constrain my hyperactivity with lorasapam and other sedatives with only a moderate amount of success; major side effect was drossiness and fatigue. I looked into the possibilities of Adderall after speaking with a coworker who was prescribed Adderall several years ago and how he was able to continue his education due to his ability effectively concentrate.  After reading more about the symptoms associated with ADD it seemed to be a perfect match to my condition. This medication has reduced much of my public speaking inhibition; I find that I am more out going
column3: in control
column4: less critical of my self
column5: and more inclined to participate in meeting and activities with minimum anxiety. My sexual drive is actually more enhanced. I am taking 5mg three times daily
column6: but am still adjusting the dosage to alleviate side effects (inability to fall asleep at night) and achieve the maximum benefit. This has been an extremely positive life changing treatment for ADD.

column1: 1685$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/16/2007 8:40:51 PM$Reviewer: Savnrse
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$5$As an adult female who has been taking this drug for years I would warn against it. It works well for me
column3: although it took a long time to find the correct doseage-10mg
column4: but I could NEVER imagine giving this to a child. I am on a low dose and I really feel side effects. Such as tenseness
column5: irratation
column6: lightheadedness
column7: and I just am not myself when I take it. Although the drug does work
column8: I would only recommend it for adults that know their bodies well and know how and when it works for them. It does have sexual side effects as well. For those looking for something for a child
column9: look for something other than these meds
column10: they are NOT for children!
